description: A Mountain Home man was killed in a motorcycle crash Sunday evening, state police said.
title: Arkansas man killed in motorcycle crash, authorities say
title_page: Arkansas man killed in motorcycle crash, authorities say
text:
A Mountain Home man was killed in a motorcycle crash Sunday evening, state police said.
58-year-old Tommy McBride was traveling west on on U.S. Highway 62 near the Arkansas 5 overpass just before 6 p.m., according to a report. Authorities said McBride lost control of his 1999 Honda motorcycle while changing lanes and was struck by a 1999 Lincoln.
McBride was taken to Baxter Regional Medical Center for his injuries and later died, according to the report.
Authorities reported no other injuries. Conditions were described as clear and dry at the time of the wreck.
At least 405 people have died on Arkansas roads so far this year, according to preliminary information.
